The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a working knowledge of German grammar through this course, which enables me to translate texts in German with the help of a dictionary and online tools.
Reading knowledge of German.
I developed skills in German grammar and vocabulary.
I learned how to translate complicated materials from German to English.
Ability to read in German

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was extremely well-organized, and I appreciated the flexibility of it being a self-led, asynchronous online course. My only suggestion for improvement is to include more opportunities to translate texts relevant to our fields of study, either as homework assignments or possibly as an exam.

There is too much work. I would have gotten just as much out of the course if there had been fewer practice sentences each week, for example. It didn't move too fast for me, BUT I'd done a lot of German grammar previously, so I imagine that it would for someone with less experience. I liked the format of reading the textbook then getting the exact same information again in video form (with helpful insights from the prof) as it made sure I really took in the information.

The strengths of the course are that it allows students to go through the material at their own pace and get feedback on their work so they know how to improve. As far as weaknesses, I think it is always challenging to do a language course in such a short amount of time.
Strengths: You learn a lot in a short period of time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to other graduate students needing to fulfill a language requirement. I felt like I learned a great deal during the five-week course.

Yes, it is a great way to fulfill the language of modern scholarship proficiency--allows for opportunity to develop further skills in German grammar and language and is well paced for a summer course.
Yes I think the class is an effective way to learn German.  The course materials and lectures are helpful.
Yes

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I hope to utilize German texts in philosophy and theology through my research.
A lot of scholarship in my field is in German, so I will certainly continue to read in German.
I hope to use my knowledge of German in my research.
